content.description: P1: Pull through a heads-up start to gain a left facing corner with crack leading to a steep crack ending in the top of a left draining gully first belay here using slings and gear (5.8). P2: fire up into short, steep left facing corner requiring balancy moves, then 3rd class scramble to top of tower (5.8). Sling blocks to build anchor.
content.location: Middle of Owl Tower south wall starting at first good belay area on approach. Right-most crack of two crack system.

content.description: Wide gulley with several climbing options. Large chock-stone mid-way up where a comfortable belay can be made if rope drag requires splitting the climb into two pitches. Build belay at top with slung boulders and gear.
content.location: Obvious gulley on right side of Owl Tower's south face. Scramble up gulley until climbing begins.

content.description: Climb up lichen covered crack system which funnels into one crack. The climbing runs out on top where boulders can be slung for the anchor.
content.location: North side of Owl Tower starting in a right facing bouldery corner. Look for an area of lichen covered rock.

content.description: Climb up left-most crack splitting the face using protection from the right-most crack as necessary. Top out on bouldery ledge and sling boulders to build anchor.
content.location: Scramble up bottom section of Parliament Gulley, then step 20' Left of Parliament Gulley starting from a belay ledge.

content.description: Awesome crack splitting a face adorned with raised plates. This route is guarded from the ground by a 50' section of smooth, blank granite. To climb, you must build an anchor above the crack and rappel down to the start ledge then climb back up. It's worth the effort!!
content.location: 30' right of Quarantine crack starting 50' up above a blank section of wall.
